intro: Casselia chamaedryfolia, commonly known as the silverleaf casselia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance. Casselia chamaedryfolia is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional Australian Aboriginal use.
